bropals.lib.simplegame.lwjgl

Class LWJGLContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • bropals.lib.simplegame.lwjgl.LWJGLContext

  • public class LWJGLContext
extends java.lang.Object
    The object to use when drawing with LWJGL, and to load textureObjects into OpenGL. Can use this object in combination with the LWJGL commands.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LWJGLContext(LWJGLGameWindow window)
      Makes a context to control rendering to a LWJGLGameWindow.

        public void loadVertexShader(java.lang.String key,
                             java.io.InputStream stream)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Loads and compiles a vertex shader from the given input.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to store the shader as.
        stream - the stream that contains the vertex shader source.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is an issue with reading the vertex shader.

      • bufferVertexDataFloat

        public void bufferVertexDataFloat(java.lang.String key,
                                  float[] data,
                                  int usage)
        Buffers float vertex data and gives it a key to reference it by. This method will bind the newly created buffer to GL_ARRAY_BUFFER.
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the buffer.
        data - the data to buffer.
        usage - the usage enum for the buffer.

      • bufferVertexData

        public void bufferVertexData(java.lang.String key,
                             java.nio.ByteBuffer data,
                             int bytes,
                             int usage)
        Buffers some byte data into a buffer, then gives the buffer a name to reference it by. This method will bind the newly created buffer to GL_ARRAY_BUFFER.
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the buffer.
        data - the data to buffer.
        bytes - the number of bytes in the buffer
        usage - the usage enum for the buffer.

      • bindBufferTo

        public void bindBufferTo(int target,
                         java.lang.String key)
        Binds the requested buffer to the requested target.
        Parameters:
        target - the target to bind the buffer to
        key - the key of the buffer to bind.

      • unbindBuffer

        public void unbindBuffer(int target)
        Unbinds the buffer at the specified target.
        Parameters:
        target - the target to unbind the buffer from.

      • loadTextureObject

        public void loadTextureObject(java.lang.String key,
                              java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                              int bytesPerPixel)
        Puts the image data into a texture map, then binds the texture map to the active texture unit, and referring to the created texture object with the given key.

        The image must be square, with its width and height a power of 2. This method does not check for the power of 2 property, but it does check to see if it is square.

        Parameters:
        key - the key that is the texture.
        image - the image data to store in a new texture object.
        bytesPerPixel - the number of bytes in each pixel. This is 4 for an RGBA image, and 3 for an RGB image.

      • createVertexObject

        public void createVertexObject(java.lang.String key)
        Creates a new vertex object that stores a vertex data format.
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the vertex object that was created.

      • getVertexShader

        public int getVertexShader(java.lang.String key)
        Gets the OpenGL name of the specified vertex shader.
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the vertex shader to get
        Returns:
        the vertex shader, or -1 if it doesn't exist.

      • setActiveTextureUnit

        public void setActiveTextureUnit(int unit)
        Sets the active texture unit. If it is out of bounds of the available texture units, then nothing happens.

        Must use the enum GL_TEXTUREi where i is the texture unit number.

        Parameters:
        unit - the texture unit to set as active.

      • getActiveTextureUnit

        public int getActiveTextureUnit()
        Gets the active texture unit.

        Will be the enum GL_TEXTUREi where i is the texture unit number.

        Returns:
        the active texture unit.

      • getTextureObject

        public int getTextureObject(java.lang.String key)
        Gets the texture object with the specified key.
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the texture object to get.
        Returns:
        the texture object, or -1 if it doesn't exist.

      • useProgram

        public void useProgram(java.lang.String programKey)
        Tell OpenGL to use the specified program, if it exists.
        Parameters:
        programKey - the program to use.

      • vertexAttribPointer

        public void vertexAttribPointer(java.lang.String variableName,
                                java.lang.String program,
                                int size,
                                int type,
                                boolean normalized,
                                int stride,
                                long pointer)
        Calls glVertexAttribPointer so that OpenGL knows the format of the vertex data that is being handed to it.
        Parameters:
        variableName - the name of the variable that is being specified in the shader.
        program - the program that contains the variable.
        size - the number of components per vertex.
        type - the data type of each element in the array.
        normalized - indicates tat the vertex data should be normalized.
        stride - the byte offset between consecutive elements in the array.
        pointer - the offset from the start of the current buffer object.

      • enableVertexAttribArray

        public void enableVertexAttribArray(java.lang.String variableName,
                                    java.lang.String program)
        Enables the vertex attribute associated with the variable name in the specified program.
        Parameters:
        variableName - the variable name of the attribute.
        program - the program that contains the variable.

      • disableVertexAttribArray

        public void disableVertexAttribArray(java.lang.String variableName,
                                     java.lang.String program)
        Disables the vertex attribute associated with the variable name in the specified program.
        Parameters:
        variableName - the variable name of the attribute.
        program - the program that contains the variable.

        Gets the window associated with this context.
